greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) is the k-th smallest least integer of prime signatures for partitions of n into distinct parts; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 1<=k<=A000009(n), read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..50, flattened
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Signature
Index entries for sequences related to prime signature
maple: b:= proc(n, i, j) option remember; `if`(i*(i+1)/2<n, [],
mathematica: Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 07 2020, after Maple *)
xref: Column k=1-3 give: A000079, A003945 for n>2, A116453 for n>4.
Last elements of rows give A332644.
Cf. A000009, A087443 (for all partitions), A087980 (as sorted sequence).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 18 2020
